TI DIELECTRIC STUDY ON MOLECULAR MOTIONS OF POLY(GLUTAMIC ACID) IN
   AQUEOUS-SOLUTION OVER A FREQUENCY-RANGE OF 10(5)-10(10) HZ
SO MACROMOLECULES
LA English
DT Article
ID POLY(L-GLUTAMIC ACID); CHAIN DYNAMICS; TIME; SPECTROSCOPY; RELAXATION;
   HYDRATION
AB Dielectric relaxation measurements over an extremely wide frequency region from 100 kHz to 20 GHz were performed on poly(glutamic acid) in dilute aqueous solution at 25-degrees-C. Three relaxation peaks could be found. The high frequency peak around 10 GHz could be easily due to orientation of water molecules, and the intermediate one around 100 MHz could be assigned to a micro-Brownian motion of the main chain. The relaxation strength of the intermediate process is proportional to f(c)4.9, where f(c) is the fraction of coil. This means that linear linkage of five repeat units in the coiled part is required for the motion. At the limit of f(c) = 1, the relaxation time for the lowest frequency process is 1 X 10(-8) s, which is in complete agreement with that for the overall rotation of a coiled polymer in solution. On the other hand it takes a value of 5 x 10(-6) s at f(c) = 0, which is reasonably in good agreement with that observed for the_ overall rotation of a rodlike polymer with the same size in solution.
RP MASHIMO, S (reprint author), TOKAI UNIV,DEPT PHYS,HIRATSUKA,KANAGAWA 25912,JAPAN.

TI STELLAR SPECTRA RECONSTRUCTION FROM SPECKLE SPECTROSCOPIC DATA .2.
SO ASTRONOMICAL JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
ID SHIFT-AND-ADD; INTERFEROMETRY; TELESCOPE; IMAGES
AB In the previous paper [AJ, 105, 665 (1993)], we described speckle spectroscopic instrumentation and presented some observational results with data acquired by our speckle spectrometer. The shift-and-add method was used for the data reduction in the previous paper. We have revised the speckle spectrometer to augment the performance. The cross-correlation method is newly introduced for data reduction. The spectra of single stars gamma Cas and alpha Per are reconstructed in nearly diffraction-limited angular resolution with the resolved Halpha emission and absorption lines, respectively. It is shown that the cross-correlation method is superior to the shift-and-add method in the narrow bandwidth region. The results of alpha Per are compared with the photometric measurement of Procyon's spectrum which has the similar spectral type as alpha Per and they are shown to be fairly consistent. The new system exhibits a sufficient performance to enable us to make the quantitative spectral analysis and the cross-correlation method produces the higher SNR results.
C1 HOKKAIDO UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL PHYS,SAPPORO,HOKKAIDO 060,JAPAN.

TI PHYSICAL-PROPERTIES AND DIMENSIONALITY OF
   KAPPA-(BEDT-TTF)2CU(CN)[N(CN)2]
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE BEDT-TTF; ORGANIC SUPERCONDUCTOR; ELECTRICAL RESISTIVITY; H(C2);
   DIMENSIONALITY
ID PRESSURE ORGANIC SUPERCONDUCTOR; BEDT-TTF; ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURES;
   CRITICAL-FIELD; TRANSITION-TEMPERATURE; CRYSTAL; DEPENDENCE; TC;
   BIS(ETHYLENEDITHIO)TETRATHIAFULVALENE; K-(BEDT-TTF)2CU<N(CN)2>BR
AB The electrical resistivity measurements for the novel organic superconductor kappa-(BEDT-TTF)2Cu(CN)[N(CN)2] (T(c)=11.2 K) [BEDT-TTF represents bis (ethylenedithiolo)tetrathiafulvalene] under pressure or in high magnetic field were studied. Several physical parameters, such as the superconducting transition temperature (T(c)), the depressibility of T(c) with pressure (-dT(c)/dP), the residual resistance ratio (RRR), the upper critical field (H(C2)), and the effective Ginzburg-Landau mass anisotropy between perpendicular and parallel to the conducting plane (m(parallel-to)/m(perpendicular-to)), are determined. They are discussed in comparison with those of other kappa-type organic superconductors with T(c) above 10 K; kappa-(BEDT-TTF)2Cu(NCS)2 and kappa-(BEDT-TTF)2 Cu[N(CN)2]Br. A simple relation was observed between these parameters (T(c), -dT(c)/dP and RRR) and the dimensionality of the electronic structures of these superconductors.

TI THE ROLE OF THE EFFECTIVE-MASS IN THE HOT-ELECTRON MAGNETOPHONON
   RESONANCE IN N-TYPE GERMANIUM
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE MAGNETOPHONON RESONANCE; HOT ELECTRON; N-GE; INTERVALLEY SCATTERING;
   EFFECTIVE MASS; HIGH MAGNETIC FIELDS
ID HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS; SI; GE
AB We have observed a novel feature in the hot-electron magnetophonon resonance in n-type germanium at pulsed high magnetic fields up to 40 T. In the longitudinal magnetophonon resonance, the resonance peaks appear as either maxima or minima depending on the difference in the effective mass between the initial and final states of the intervalley scattering by phonons. The results are interpreted in terms of the mobility change of conduction electrons at the resonance.

TI PARALLEL SCHEME OF THE ITERATIVE BLIND DECONVOLUTION METHOD FOR STELLAR
   OBJECT RECONSTRUCTION
SO APPLIED OPTICS
LA English
DT Article
DE BLIND DECONVOLUTION; SPECKLE INTERFEROMETRY; IMAGE RECONSTRUCTION
ID PHASE
AB An algorithm for stellar object reconstruction without a reference star is described. The algorithm is based on parallel application of the iterative blind deconvolution method to several speckle frames, and it permits reconstruction of an object that satisfies the convolution relation in all the frames used. Computer simulations with noisy speckle images are carried out to demonstrate performances of the algorithm. The algorithm is applied to observational data of binary stars, and high-resolution images are clearly reconstructed. Binary parameters extracted from the images show good consistency with those obtained both with the power spectrum analysis and with the shift-and-add method.
C1 NATL ASTRON OBSERV, MITAKA, TOKYO 181, JAPAN.

TI CARBON-DIOXIDE SENSOR USING COMBINATION OF FLUORIDE-ION CONDUCTOR AND
   METAL CARBONATE
SO CHEMISTRY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID CO2 GAS SENSOR; SOLID-ELECTROLYTE; ROOM-TEMPERATURE; LAF3
AB A solid-state electrochemical CO2 sensor was obtained by combining a fluoride ion conductor (LaF3) with an auxiliary phase of a metal carbonate. The sensor response (EMF) was found to follow the Nernst's equation for a 2-electron reduction of CO2 in the range of 40 - 2000 ppm at 400 and 450-degrees-C. The 90% response times were as short as 10-20 s at 400-degrees-C. The sensing mechanism of this new type CO2 sensor was discussed.

TI HIGH-FIELD CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE AND IMPURITY TRANSITION IN N-TYPE AND
   P-TYPE 3C-SIC AT MAGNETIC-FIELDS UP TO 175-T
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID CHEMICAL VAPOR-DEPOSITION; TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE;
   ELECTRICAL-PROPERTIES; CONDUCTION-BAND; SINGLE
AB Magnetotransmission experiments have been carried out on 3C-SiC thin films grown on Si(100) substrates, using the combination of pulsed high magnetic fields up to 175 T generated by the single-turn coil technique and pulsed far-infrared radiations from a H2O (D2O) laser at photon energies up to 73.2 meV. In n-type 3C-SiC, two cyclotron-resonance (CR) peaks have been observed for E\\k\\ [100] over a wide range of photon energy 10.4-53.8 meV, corresponding to the light- and heavy-mass valleys at the X points,i.e.,m(t)* = (0.25 +/- 0.01) m0 and (m(t)* m(l)*)1/2 = (0.41 +/- 0.01)m0. These values are in agreement with those of Kaplan et al. obtained from CR at low fields. This leads to the conclusion that the conduction band in 3C-SiC is very parabolic up to 53.8 meV, and that unlike GaP the effect of camel's-back structure is unobservable. A number of impurity transitions were observed at temperatures below 100 K with photon energies ranging from 34.4 to 73.2 meV. It was found that the observed lines originate from three different donor states which have different binding energies, E(d) = 19, 35, and 53 meV. The observation of hole CR was also made in p-type 3C-SiC. A broad but prominent peak was observed with an effective mass of 0.45 m0, at temperatures around 210 K and at a wavelength of 119 mum.

TI HIGH-FIELD CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE AND VALENCE-BAND STRUCTURE IN
   SEMICONDUCTING DIAMOND
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRON EFFECTIVE MASSES; NATURAL DIAMOND; LATTICE SCATTERING;
   MAGNETIC-FIELDS
AB The cyclotron resonance of thermally excited free holes has been observed in synthetic semiconducting diamond at ultrahigh magnetic fields up to 150 T generated by the single-turn-coil technique with pulsed far-infrared laser radiations of 28, 36, and 119 mum. Three absorption peaks were observed at and above room temperature for the magnetic fields parallel to the [100), [111], and [110) crystallographic directions. The typical value of omega(c)tau was as small as 2 at 40-degrees-C even in ultrahigh fields. One of the three peaks was observed in the cyclotron-resonance inactive circular polarization for holes, while the other two lines were observed in cyclotron-resonance active circular polarization for holes. Assuming that these resonance absorption lines are due to three holes of the valence bands at the GAMMA point, i.e., light-hole, heavy-hole, amd split-off-hole, we can conclude that the band dispersion curve for one of the three bands has a negative (electronlike) curvature in some directions.
C1 SUMITOMO ELECT IND LTD,ITAMI,HYOGO 664,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC PHASE-DIAGRAM OF THE SPIN-PEIERLS CUPRATE CUGEO3
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID TRANSITION; POLYACETYLENE; SYSTEMS
AB The magnetization of the spin-Peierls cuprate CuGeO3 was measured in magnetic fields up to 25 T at constant temperatures from 3.5 to 20.3 K. The transition temperature without the field is 14.0 K. The characteristic nonlinearity of the magnetization was observed below 13.4 K, which means the transition was from a dimerized phase to other phases. This transition is of first and second order below and above 10.0 K, respectively. The critical field of the transition between dimerized and magnetic phases is 12-13 T. The magnetic phase diagram of CuGeO3 agrees qualitatively with both experimental results of typical organic spin-Peierls materials and a theoretical calculation.

TI WAVE-FRONT CORRECTION FROM POINT-SPREAD FUNCTION DATA
SO APPLIED OPTICS
LA English
DT Article
DE ADAPTIVE OPTICS; PHASE RECOVERY; ASTRONOMY
ID ADAPTIVE OPTICS; NEURAL-NETWORK; RETRIEVAL; SYSTEM
AB A distorted wave front is estimated from the intensity distribution on a focal plane. The information of the estimated wave front is used to control an adaptive mirror that corrects an atmospherically distorted wave front. A new approach to correct a distorted wave front is proposed. Several computer simulations confirm that a distorted wave front can be corrected from the information of the intensity distribution on a focal plane.

TI SYNTHESIS OF PROLYL ENDOPEPTIDASE INHIBITORS AND EVALUATION OF THEIR
   STRUCTURE-ACTIVITY-RELATIONSHIPS - IN-VITRO INHIBITION OF PROLYL
   ENDOPEPTIDASE FROM CANINE BRAIN
SO CHEMICAL & PHARMACEUTICAL BULLETIN
LA English
DT Article
DE PROLYL ENDOPEPTIDASE; INHIBITOR; STRUCTURE ACTIVITY RELATIONSHIP;
   4-PHENYLBUTANOYL DERIVATIVE; 4-(2-THIENYL)BUTANOYL DERIVATIVE
ID PROLINE-CLEAVING ENZYME; RABBIT BRAIN; BOVINE BRAIN; RAT-BRAIN;
   PURIFICATION; DEGRADATION; DERIVATIVES; TRH
AB By chemical modification (of a known prolyl endopeptidase (PEP) inhibitor (N-[N-(4-phenylbutanoyl)-L-prolyl]pyrrolidine; SUAM-1221), several arylalkanoyl derivatives (V-1-27) were synthesized and tested for in vitro inhibitory activity towards PEP from canine brain. Among them, 4-(2-thienyl)butanoyl derivatives (V-24-27) showed more potent PEP-inhibitory activity than SUAM-1221. The structure-activity relationships of these compounds are discussed.

TI SUPERCONDUCTING AND NORMAL STATES OF BA1-XKXBIO3 STUDIED WITH USE OF
   HIGH-QUALITY THIN-FILMS
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID METAL-SEMICONDUCTOR TRANSITION; BI-O SYSTEM; ENERGY-GAP;
   INSULATOR-TRANSITION; ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURE; RAMAN-SCATTERING;
   BAPB1-XBIXO3; DENSITY; BA0.6K0.4BIO3; TEMPERATURE
AB An extensive study of Ba0.55K0.45BiO3 thin films is reported, including precise measurements of the transport coefficients, the reflectivity spectrum, the Raman spectra, the upper critical field, and the superconducting energy gap. From the results for the normal-state properties, it is suggested that the electronic state in the metallic phase of Ba1-xKxBiO3 can be described by a simple band picture. The measurement of the superconducting-state properties shows good consistency with this picture within the BCS framework. Based on these experimental results, we firmly conclude that the density of states in the conduction band of Ba1-xKxBiO3 is close to that expected from a band model in its metallic phase and the superconductivity is of BCS type. The coupling strength lambda is similar to 1 is also estimated from the gap measurements and the temperature dependence of the resistivity.

TI MAGNETOOPTICAL EFFECTS OF EXCITONS IN BII3 CRYSTALS UNDER PULSED HIGH
   MAGNETIC-FIELDS .2. EXCITONS LOCALIZED AT 2-DIMENSIONAL DEFECTS
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID SINGLE-CRYSTALS; DIMENSIONAL EXCITONS
AB Magneto-optical spectra for various types of excitons localized at two-dimensional (2D) defects in BiI3 crystals were investigated in pulsed high magnetic fields up to 42 T. The localized excitons were observed as very sharp lines below the indirect exciton energy. For all these exciton transitions, we have observed common features such as very large anisotropy with respect to both the magnetic-field direction and the incident light polarization, characteristic energy shifts to high or low energy side with B2 dependence, and growth of new lines with increasing fields. The observed magnetic-field effects were interpreted in terms of the Zeeman terms of cationic excitons perturbed by various kinds of stacking disorders that have 2D characters.

TI MAGNETORESISTANCE AND UPPER CRITICAL FIELDS OF BA1-XKXBIO3 THIN-FILMS
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID SUPERCONDUCTING BA1-XKXBIO3; MAGNETIC-FIELDS; BA0.6K0.4BIO3
AB We measured magnetoresistance in Ba0.55K0.45BiO3 thin film grown by rf-magnetron sputtering under pulsed high magnetic fields up to 40 T at temperatures down to 4.2 K. The upper critical field H(c2) was determined from the midpoint. The H(c2) at T = 0 K was estimated to be 24 T for a sample with T(c) = 20 K, and 17 T for another sample with T(c) = 22 K. It turned out that the WHH (Werthamer-Helfand-Hohenberg) theory is not applicable to explain the H(c2) vs. temperature curve of these samples.

TI MFH-1, A NEW MEMBER OF THE FORK HEAD DOMAIN FAMILY, IS EXPRESSED IN
   DEVELOPING MESENCHYME
SO FEBS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE BRAIN; DEVELOPMENT; FORK HEAD DOMAIN; KIDNEY; MESODERM; MESENCHYME
ID TRANSCRIPTION FACTORS; GENE FAMILY; DNA; PROTEINS; ENCODES; CELLS
AB We have isolated a novel mouse gene, MFH-1 (mesenchyme fork head 1) that is related to the Drosophila fork head and rat HNF3 genes. MFH-1 encodes a distinct fork head domain that is classified into a distinct subfamily. A recombinant MFH-I protein could bind to the HNF3 binding site. MFH-1 is expressed temporally in developing embryos, first in the non-notochordal mesoderm and later in areas of mesenchymal condensation in the trunk, head, and limbs. Our results suggest that MFH-1 might be involved in the formation of special mesenchymal tissues.
C1 OSAKA UNIV,SCH MED,DEPT ANAT & NEUROSCI,SUITA,OSAKA 565,JAPAN.
RP MIURA, N (reprint author), OSAKA UNIV,INST MOLEC & CELLULAR BIOL,1-3 YAMADA OKA,SUITA,OSAKA 565,JAPAN.

TI SOLID-ELECTROLYTE CARBON-DIOXIDE SENSOR USING SODIUM IONIC CONDUCTOR AND
   LITHIUM CARBONATE-BASED AUXILIARY PHASE
SO APPLIED PHYSICS A-MATERIALS SCIENCE & PROCESSING
LA English
DT Article
ID CO2
AB A solid electrolyte CO2 sensor using a sodium ionic conductor and a lithium carbonate-based auxiliary phase was investigated. The sensor responded excellently to CO2 in the temperature range of 350-600-degrees-C, without being affected by coexistent water vapor. The EMF responses to varying partial pressures of CO2 (P(CO2) followed a 2-electron reaction of CO2 under fixed    P(O2) Under fixed P(CO2) (2 x 10(-3) atm), the EMF was found to be almost independent of P(O2), at temperatures above 450-degrees-C, while it depended on P(O2) following a 2-electron reaction of O2 at 305-degrees-C and below. Two alternative sensing electrode reactions were proposed to take place depending on the working temperature.

TI TYPE-I-TYPE-II TRANSITION IN GAAS ALAS SHORT-PERIOD SUPERLATTICES
   STUDIED UNDER PULSED HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS AND HIGH-PRESSURES
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID QUANTUM-WELL STRUCTURES; GAAS/ALAS SUPERLATTICES; ELECTRONIC-PROPERTIES;
   CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE; OPTICAL-PROPERTIES; 001 SUPERLATTICES; INDIRECT
   EXCITONS; UNIAXIAL-STRESS; BAND-STRUCTURE; HETEROSTRUCTURES
AB We have observed type-I-type-II transition in photoluminescence spectra of Ga-As/AlAs short period superlattices under pulsed high magnetic fields up to 150 T and hydrostatic pressures up to 30 kbar. In magneto-photoluminescence spectra, the luminescence intensity showed an abrupt decrease at some critical magnetic field due to a GAMMA-X crossover in the conduction band, and also a remarkable hysteresis when the pulsed fields were swept up and down. The hysteresis arises from the fast sweep of the field pulse in the similar time scale to the lifetime of the type-II exciton, as shown by a rate equation analysis based on a two-level model. The controversial electron effective mass of the AlAs X-point was estimated as m(X)=0.16+/-0.07 m0.

   EAVES, L
TI THE ROLE OF EMITTER STATES IN MAGNETOTUNNELING THROUGH DOUBLE-BARRIER
   RESONANT-TUNNELING DIODES AT HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID TUNNELLING STRUCTURES; DEVICES; HETEROSTRUCTURES; SPECTROSCOPY;
   BISTABILITY
AB By applying pulsed high magnetic fields up to 40 T perpendicular (B(perpendicular-to) perpendicular-to I) and parallel (B(parallel-to) parallel-to I) to the current direction, a distinct role of emitter states in the magneto-tunneling processes through resonant tunneling diodes has been investigated. The B(perpendicular-to) dependence of the threshold voltage in current vs. voltage (I-V) curves has been explained consistently by tunneling from a combined magneto-electric state of a 1-dimensional (1D) emitter to that of a 0-dimensional (0D) well state. We observed a drastic current decrease above B(parallel-to) = 10 T under constant applied voltage below the negative differential conductivity region together with multi-peaked I-V curves with hysteresis at above B(parallel-to) = 30 T. These distinct features were analyzed by a self-consistent model of the charge build-up effect and the energy configuration of the 0D emitter, 1D emitter and 0D well states.

   HORIKOSHI, Y
TI MAGNETIC-FIELD-INDUCED SADDLE-POINT IN GAAS ALGAAS SHORT-PERIOD
   SUPERLATTICES
SO SOLID STATE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID ABSORPTION; EXCITONS
AB We have measured interband magneto-absorption spectra of (GaAs)6/(Al0.51Ga0.49As)6=(6,6) and (GaAs)14/(AlAs)6=(14,6) under pulsed high magnetic fields up to 150T. In sample (6,6), drastic broadening of the exciton peak due to a magnetic field-induced saddle point was observed when high magnetic fields were applied in the direction parallel to the layer planes and the cyclotron radius became smaller than the superlattice period. The line shape of the broadened exciton resonance was qualitatively understood as an effect of the Coulomb interaction between electrons and holes. The exciton binding energy of sample (6,6) was estimated as 7.0meV using the perturbational theory, which reflects an intermediate nature of the superlattice between bulk crystals and two-dimensional quantum wells.
C1 NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,MUSASHINO ELECT COMMUN LABS,MUSASHINO,TOKYO 180,JAPAN.
RP SASAKI, S (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI PIEZOELECTRIC CRYSTAL IMMUNOSENSOR FOR SENSITIVE DETECTION OF
   METHAMPHETAMINE (STIMULANT DRUG) IN HUMAN URINE
SO SENSORS AND ACTUATORS B-CHEMICAL
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL MEETING ON CHEMICAL SENSORS
CY SEP 13-17, 1992
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN ASSOC CHEM SENSORS, ELECTROCHEM SOC JAPAN, CATALYSIS SOC JAPAN, CERAM SOC JAPAN, CHEM SOC JAPAN, INST ELECT ENGINEERS JAPAN, ION ENGN SOC JAPAN, IRON & STEEL INST JAPAN, JAPAN INST MET, JAPAN SOC ANAL CHEM
ID BIOSENSOR; IMMUNOASSAY
AB We have developed an immunosensor based on a piezoelectric quartz resonator, which detects methamphetamine (MA) in liquids from a shift of the resonant frequency. The sensor has MA-albumin conjugates immobilized on the resonator and its resonant frequency shifts downward on contact with the monoclonal antibody to MA dissolved in the phosphate buffer solution. Under the condition of a fixed concentration of the antibody, the frequency shift is attenuated by mixing MA with the antibody solution. Based on this principle, it has been possible to detect 0.02-100 ppm MA with a detection time of about 7 min. The sensor has proved to be sensitive and stable enough to detect the critical concentration (1 ppm) of MA in human urine.
C1 UBE IND LTD,CENT RES LAB,UBE,YAMAGUCHI 755,JAPAN.
   HIROSHIMA PREFECTURAL UNIV,SCH BIORESOURCES,SHOUBARA,HIROSHIMA 727,JAPAN.

TI DEVELOPMENT OF HIGH-PERFORMANCE SOLID-ELECTROLYTE SENSORS FOR NO AND NO2
SO SENSORS AND ACTUATORS B-CHEMICAL
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL MEETING ON CHEMICAL SENSORS
CY SEP 13-17, 1992
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN ASSOC CHEM SENSORS, ELECTROCHEM SOC JAPAN, CATALYSIS SOC JAPAN, CERAM SOC JAPAN, CHEM SOC JAPAN, INST ELECT ENGINEERS JAPAN, ION ENGN SOC JAPAN, IRON & STEEL INST JAPAN, JAPAN INST MET, JAPAN SOC ANAL CHEM
ID OXIDE
AB This paper demonstrates the development of solid-state NO(x) sensors based on various combinations of solid electrolytes and auxiliary sensing materials. The Na+ conductor-based sensor fitted with NaNO3 gives rather good sensing properties to NO,, but this sensor should be operated at temperatures below the melting point of NaNO3 (307-degrees-C), in addition to being incapable of detecting NO. Higher-temperature operation is achieved by the use of Ba(NO3)2-based material for the auxiliary sensing electrode. The use of NaNO2 is found to give excellent sensing characteristics to both NO2 and NO, following Nernst's equation. Surprisingly the NO(x) responses of these sensors are totally independent of coexistent oxygen, requiring re-examination of the sensing mechanisms.

TI MAGNETOREFLECTION OF THE LOWEST EXCITON IN A LAYERED PEROVSKITE-TYPE
   COMPOUND (C10H21NH3)2PBI4
SO SOLID STATE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS; 40-T
AB Magnetoreflection spectra in the Faraday configuration have been investigated up to 40 T at 4.2K for a single crystal of (C10H21NH3)2PbI4, which consists of two-dimensional networks of corner-sharing octahedra [PbI6]4-. The Zeeman shift is observed, and the effective g-factor is 1.42+/-0.04. The observed diamagnetic shift of the lowest exciton is (7 +/- 4) x 10(-8)eV/T2, from which the two-dimensional Bohr radius is estimated to be 7 angstrom at most. It suggests that the exciton wave function extends only to the 4 nearest neighbor octahedra [PbI6]4-in the two-dimensional layer. By referring to the resonant Raman scattering spectra and reflection spectra of strained single crystals, a few narrow dips in high reflectivity region of the lowest exciton are ascribed to the vibronic excitons.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
RP HIRASAWA, M (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI TRANSPORT-PROPERTIES AND ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURE OF THE NOVEL ORGANIC
   SUPERCONDUCTOR KAPPA-(BEDT-TTF)2CU(CN)[N(CN)2](TC=11.2K)
SO SYNTHETIC METALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY OF SYNTHETIC METALS ( ICSM
   92 )
CY AUG 12-18, 1992
CL GOTEBORG, SWEDEN
DE BEDT-TTF; SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; DIMENSIONALITY; TRANSPORT PROPERTY
ID BEHAVIOR
AB The electronic structure of the novel organic superconductor kappa-(BEDT-TTF)2Cu(CN)[N(CN)2] (+kappa-CN) is studied in comparison with those of kappa-(BEDT-TTF)2Cu(NCS), (+kappa-NCS) and kappa-(BEDT-TTF)2Cu[N(CN)2]Br (+kappa-Br).  The pressure dependence of Tc (-dTc/dP) value, residual resistance ratio (RRR) and H(c2)+/H(c2)I of kappa-CN are 2.5 and 150, 1/6.8, respectively. These values are just between those of other two superconductors. The conductivity anisotropy of the kappa-CN salt (sigma(I)/sigma(perpendicular-to)=230) shows the electronical three-dimensionality slightly less than that of kappa-Br salt but such higher than that of kappa-NCS salt. The transport properties ( -dTc/dP, RRR and H(c2)(perpendicular-to)/H(c2)I) are discussed in terms of the degree of dimensionality.

TI ULTRA-HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELD EFFECT ON THE STRUCTURAL PHASE-TRANSITION IN
   (PB, GE)TE
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE ULTRA-HIGH MAGNETIC FIELD; SINGLE-TURN COIL TECHNIQUE; STRUCTURAL PHASE
   TRANSITION; INFRARED MAGNETO-TRANSMISSION; PBGETE; PBTE
ID ELECTRON-PHONON INTERACTION; SEMICONDUCTORS; PB1-XGEXTE; GE; PB
AB Magnetic field effects on the structural phase transition in p-Pb1-xGeTe(x=0.01) and n-Pb1-xGexTe (x=0.008) have been investigated by infrared magneto-transmission measurements in the megagauss range using the single-turn coil technique. We have found that the transition temperature T(c) increases by 14 K by the application of magnetic fields of 90 T parallel to the [111] direction in p-type samples whose T(c) at 0 T is 34 K. Similar dependence has been observed in n-type samples. These results not only provide a support to the previous work by Takaoka and Murase in the low field range below 7 T but also show that the magnetic field effect on the phase transition is even enhanced in the ultra-high magnetic field range without any saturation. We have estimated the critical field of the possible structural phase transition induced by magnetic fields in PbTe.

TI SPIN SPLIT CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE IN A 2-D ELECTRON-SYSTEM AT VERY HIGH
   MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID NON-PARABOLICITY; CONDUCTION-BAND; GAAS; ANISOTROPY
AB Cyclotron resonance of the 2-Dimensional Electron System in GaAs/Ga0.66Al0.34As heterojunctions has been studied in very high (approximately 90 T) magnetic fields. The resonance is found to split into two components due to the energy dependence of the electron g-factor. The exact magnitude of the splitting is slightly smaller than observed in bulk GaAs, but is found to be carrier concentration dependent. The intensity of the two different transitions is also found to be carrier concentration dependent, despite the fact that the electron g-factor of the Lowest Landau state is close to zero. This behaviour is interpreted as due to collective electron effects similar to results observed at lower densities and lower temperatures in lower magnetic fields.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
   UNIV NOTTINGHAM,DEPT PHYS,NOTTINGHAM NG7 2RD,ENGLAND.

TI NORMAL PHONON OF SUPERCONDUCTING BI2SR2CACU2OY AND BI2SR2CA2CU3OY
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON THE INDUSTRIAL APPLICATIONS OF THE MOSSBAUER
   EFFECT
CY AUG 24-27, 1992
CL OTSU, JAPAN
SP RYUKOKU UNIV, NISSIN STEEL
ID TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE; RAMAN
AB Anomalous softening of the Cu-site vibration was observed at the superconducting transition temperature (T(c)) in the Sn-119 Mossbauer spectra of the YBa2Cu(Sn)3O7-y.  On the contrary, only the normal phonon was observed in the Sn-119 Mossbauer spectra of the superconducting Bi2Sr2CaCu(Sn)2Oy and Bi2Sr2Ca2Cu(Sn)3Oy having T(c)'s of 77 and 108 K, respectively. This is ascribed to the characteristic feature of the layer structure which has little interaction between the copper planars involved with the superconducting transition. The normal phonon is matched with the theoretical curve of the ''combined Debye and Einstein'' model which is usually applied to semiconductor and insulator.
C1 TOKYO METROPOLITAN UNIV,RI RES CTR,HACHIOJI 19203,JAPAN.

AB Magneto-absorption measurements were executed on n-SiC up to 150 T for a wide range of temperatures and incident photon energies. TI CHARACTERISTICS AND SENSING MECHANISM OF SO(X) SENSOR USING STABILIZED
   ZIRCONIA AND METAL SULFATE
SO SENSORS AND ACTUATORS B-CHEMICAL
LA English
DT Article
ID SULFUR-OXIDES; SOLID ELECTROLYTE; SODIUM-SULFATE; DETECTORS; NASICON;
   AIR
AB Solid-state electrochemical SO2 sensors have been developed by using an MgO-stabilized zirconia tube coated with metal sulphates, such as Li2SO4, Na2SO4, Li2SO4-CaSO4, and Li2SO4-CaSO4-SiO2. The sensors exhibit fairly good sensing properties for 10-200 ppm SO2 in air at 600-800-degrees-C, with their e.m.f. responses following Nernst's equation for the two-electron reduction of SO2. The response rates can be improved by the use of binary sulphates: Li2SO4 - CaSO4 (6:4 in molar ratio) gives 90% response and 90% recovery times of 12 s and 2.5 min, respectively, for 130 ppm SO2 at 800-degrees-C. The response is found to be further improved with the ternary system Li2SO4 - CaSO4 -SiO2 (4:4:2 in molar ratio).
RP YAN, YT (reprint author), KYUSHU UNIV,GRAD SCH ENGN SCI,DEPT MAT SCI & TECHNOL,KASUGA,FUKUOKA 816,JAPAN.

TI EXCITON LOCALIZATION IN CD1-XMNXTE AND ITS DEPENDENCE ON THE STRONG
   MAGNETIC-FIELD
SO SOLID STATE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
AB The magneto-photo-luminescence in Cd1-xMnxTe (x = 0.13-0.4) was investigated in magnetic fields up to 43T by a pulsed magnet at T = 4.2 K. Significant behaviour of exciton peak intensity, half-line width and spectral line shape of the exciton emission band was observed and interpreted in terms of free magnetic polaron effect depending on the magnetic field and manganese concentration.

TI EFFECT OF ANION ORDERING SUPERLATTICE ON THE ELECTRONIC-PROPERTIES OF
   (TMTSF)2X UNDER MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO SYNTHETIC METALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY OF SYNTHETIC METALS ( ICSM
   92 )
CY AUG 12-18, 1992
CL GOTEBORG, SWEDEN
AB The effects of the anion ordering in (TMTSF)2X under magnetic fields are discussed. As models of (TMTSF)2X with anion ordering, we consider the highly anisotropic two-dimensional electron systems with weak lateral superlattice potentials. By studying the magnetic energy spectra of these model systems fully quantum-mechanically, we deduce the paramagnetic quantum oscillations and the suppression of the FISDW instability due to the superlattice potential. These results gives possible explanations for the different FISDW features among TMTSF compounds and the rapid oscillations.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PURE & APPL SCI,MEGURO KU,TOKYO 153,JAPAN.

TI A NOVEL ELECTRONIC-STATE IN (BEDT-TTF)2XHG(SCN)4 - X=K, NH4
SO SYNTHETIC METALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY OF SYNTHETIC METALS ( ICSM
   92 )
CY AUG 12-18, 1992
CL GOTEBORG, SWEDEN
ID MAGNETORESISTANCE; (BEDT-TTF)2KHG(SCN)4
AB Magnetotransport measurements are made in the title compounds under high pressures. An anomalous state is found in the low-temperature-low-field-low-pressure regime in the K-compound while the NH4-one behaves as expected from the current model for quasi two-dimensional electronic systems. The anomalies are found in the so-called angle-dependent oscillation of magnetoresistance and the field and temperature dependence of the resistance. A phase diagram for the K-compound is made experimentally and electronic structures are discussed in relation to the possible spin-density wave found already in the anomalous state.

TI STELLAR SPECTRA RECONSTRUCTION FROM SPECKLE SPECTROSCOPIC DATA
SO ASTRONOMICAL JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
ID SHIFT-AND-ADD; INTERFEROMETRY; RESOLUTION; IMAGES
AB We describe a method to reconstruct stellar spectra from dispersed speckle data with diffraction-limited angular resolution. A shift-and-add (SAA) method is applied on many short exposure frames, each of which contains a dispersed speckle image and a corresponding nondispersed speckle image as a reference. The spectra of the binary star ADS 16836 were reconstructed in wideband and low dispersion mode from the data taken with the Hokudai speckle spectroscopic camera system using the Okayama 188 cm telescope. The result shows the well-separated spectra of the primary and the secondary stars, which are otherwise too close to be distinguishable due to atmospheric turbulence. We also analyzed narrow-band medium dispersion data from epsilon Her and P Cyg obtained with the Steward Observatory speckle spectroscopy system at the KPNO 4 m telescope and diffraction-limited spectra of unresolvable epsilon Her and resolved P Cyg were reconstructed. The Hbeta lines of the absorption and the emission are found in the 24 nm spectral region spanning Hbeta for epsilon Her and P Cyg spectra, respectively. These results demonstrate high spatial resolution spectroscopy for a binary star and for a resolvable hypergiant using our SAA speckle method.
C1 UNIV ARIZONA,STEWARD OBSERV,TUCSON,AZ 85721.
RP KUWAMURA, S (reprint author), HOKKAIDO UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL PHYS,SAPPORO,HOKKAIDO 060,JAPAN.

TI INFLUENCE OF OXYGEN ON DETECTION OF NITROGEN-OXIDES WITH SOLID
   ELECTROLYTE SENSOR USING NANO3
SO CHEMISTRY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB The solid electrolyte sensor device using a sodium ionic conductor and NaNO3 (auxiliary phase) was found to exhibit a remarkable feature that its EMF response to NO2 is totally independent of the concentration of coexisting oxygen. The response to NO, however, was seriously affected by the presence and absence of O2, suggesting the oxidation of NO to NO2 prior to being sensed. In the absence of NOx, the sensor EMF changed with changing oxygen concentration following the Nernst's equation for a 2-electron reaction of O2.

TI NEW FEATURES IN MAGNETOOPTICAL SPECTRA OF GAAS/ALXGA1-XAS SHORT-PERIOD
   SUPERLATTICES OBSERVED UNDER PULSED HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS UP TO 150-T
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID HYDROSTATIC-PRESSURE; EXCITONS; PHOTOLUMINESCENCE
AB We have observed two new phenomena in high-field magneto-optical spectra of GaAs/AlxGa1-xAs short-period superlattices. The first is anomalous exciton peak-width broadening observed in (GaAs)6/(Al0.51Ga0.49As)6 resulting from a magnetic-field-induced saddle point. The second is a magnetic-field-induced type-I-type-II transition in (GaAs)15/(AlAs)13. A hysteresis was observed in magneto-photoluminescence spectra. which reflects a similar time scale between the field pulse and the lifetime of the type-II exciton.

TI MAGNETOOPTICAL STUDY ON THE EXCITONIC SPECTRUM OF (C6H13NH3)2PBI4
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID FIELDS; 40-T; (C10H21NH3)2PBI4; PBI2
AB Magneto-absorption spectra have been measured over the lowest-energy exciton region of a layered perovskite-type material (C6H13NH3)2PbI4 under pulsed high magnetic fields up to 42 T at 4.2 K. The magnetic fields are applied parallel and perpendicular to the c axis. The Zeeman splitting with small diamagnetic shifts has obviously been observed in the parallel-field configuration. The anisotropic Zeeman splittings have been observed in the perpendicular-field configuration. The diamagnetic shifts observed arc very small, indicating that the Wannier-exciton model based on the effective mass approximation is not appropriate for the lowest-energy excitons in (C6H13NH3)2PbI4. The anisotropic Zeeman splittings are well explained in terms of the cationic Frenkel-exciton model.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RP KATAOKA, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL PHYS,7-3-1 HONGO,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI ZEEMAN EFFECT ON THE ZERO-PHONON LINE OF THE NV CENTER IN SYNTHETIC
   DIAMOND
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID STATE
AB To study the electronic states of an NV center in synthetic type-Ib diamonds, the Zeeman effect of the zero-phonon line (ZPL) in the absorption spectrum has been examined under high magnetic fields B, up to 150 T at 77 K. The absorption peak energies for circularly polarized lights sigma+ and sigma- are shifted oppositely and nonlinearly to the magnetic fields for B parallel-to [1 0 0] in the Faraday configuration. The Zeeman splitting is 2.2 meV at 150 T, which leads to a g value of 0.22. It has been concluded that the orbital magnetic moment of the doubly degenerate excited state is partially quenched because the orbital degeneracy is lifted by an internal strain.
C1 SUMITOMO ELECT IND LTD,ITAMI RES LABS,HYOGO,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI ULTRA-HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELD CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE OF ZERO-GAP INAS/GASB
   SUPERLATTICES
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
AB Ultra-high magnetic field (<150 T) cyclotron resonance has been studied in superlattices of InAs/GaSb with band gaps close to zero where the effects of conduction and valence bands are enhanced. Several samples exhibit a low-field structure associated with the N = 2 and 4 harmonics of the cyclotron resonance. The interband transition data is also shown.

TI ANOMALOUS TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE OF THE EFFECTIVE MASS IN PBTE AND PBSE
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
AB We measured the cyclotron resonances in n-type and p-type PbSe in a wide temperature range between 19 K and 297 K using ultra-strong magnetic fields generated in a single-turn coil system and observed a large positive temperature dependence of the effective masses (m*). We have given an empirical expression to the temperature dependence of m* at each cyclotron energy in PbSe and PbTe.

TI OBSERVATION OF CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE IN LOW-MOBILITY SEMICONDUCTORS USING
   PULSED ULTRA-HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID EFFECTIVE MASSES; ALAS
AB Far-infrared magneto-transmission experiments have been carried out on three low-mobility semiconductors (diamond, 3C-SiC and AlAs) in pulsed high magnetic fields up to 150 T generated by the single-turn coil technique. Although these materials have attracted much attention from technological points of view, detailed energy band structures have not been understood well enough because of their low carrier mobility. We report observations of cyclotron resonances and impurity transitions in these previously unmeasurable substances, which were made possible by the use of extremely strong magnetic fields.

TI QUANTUM-LIMIT BEHAVIOR OF MAGNETO-TUNNELING IN AN ALGAAS/GAAS/ALGAAS
   DOUBLE-BARRIER STRUCTURE UNDER HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS UP TO 40-T
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID CHARGE ACCUMULATION; SPECTROSCOPY; DEVICES; PHOTOLUMINESCENCE;
   SCATTERING
AB By applying pulsed high magnetic fields up to 40 T, we studied magneto-tunneling properties in AlGaAs/GaAs/AlGaAs double-barrier resonant-tunneling devices in a quantum-limit regime. A distinct resonance of tunneling current and a hysteresis of current vs voltage curves which originate from the discreteness of the density of states and the effect of charge build-up were observed. A self-consistent model of charge build-up in the well layer considering both the 0- and 1-dimensional emitter states was developed, which explained the mechanism of these observations well. It has been shown that the tunneling from the 0- and 1-dimensional emitter states to the 0-dimensional well state determines the magneto-tunneling current and that the Fermi energy oscillation in the quantum-limit regime is consistently understood by the energy configuration of these Landau levels.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
   UNIV NOTTINGHAM,DEPT PHYS,NOTTINGHAM NG7 2RD,ENGLAND.

TI HIGH-MAGNETIC-FIELD EFFECTS ON A RESONANT-TUNNELING HOT-ELECTRON
   TRANSISTOR MEASURED UP TO 40-T
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID CURRENT-VOLTAGE CHARACTERISTICS
AB Base and collector currents have been measured in a resonant-tunneling hot-electron transistor based on an InAlAs/InGaAs heterostructure at 4.2 K in pulsed magnetic fields up to 42.5 T. Base and collector current strongly depend on the field and its orientation. Our observations are compared with the field dependence of the tunneling characteristic of double-barrier structures based on GaAs/(Al, Ga)As.
C1 FUJITSU LTD,ATSUGI,JAPAN.

TI STUDY OF NEGATIVE DIFFERENTIAL CONDUCTIVITY IN AN INAS/GASB/INAS DIODE
   UNDER PULSED HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID SINGLE-BARRIER HETEROSTRUCTURES; INTERBAND TUNNELING DEVICES
AB Current vs voltage characteristics of InAs/GaSb/InAs diodes were studied in two samples with a different width of GaSb layers under pulsed high magnetic fields up to 40 T. A current peak of negative differential conductivity was found to decrease with increasing magnetic fields. Moreover, more than two small current peaks were found in the range of magnetic fields above 20 T. Positions of these peaks moved to lower voltage with an increase of magnetic field. The possible explanations for these peaks are described.

TI HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELD STUDIES OF THE CROSSED-GAP SUPERLATTICE SYSTEM
   INAS/GASB
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH

CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID TWO-DIMENSIONAL HOLES; GASB SUPER-LATTICES; CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE; BAND;
   HETEROJUNCTIONS
AB A variety of optical and electrical studies are described for superlattices and heterostructures based on the materials system InAs/GaSb. The crossed-band-gap alignment of this system leads to a semimetal to semiconductor transition as a function of either superlattice period, magnetic field or pressure. Cyclotron resonance is studied for both electrons and holes, and the electron resonance is observed in the magnetic field range where the field induced band crossing occurs. Studies of the pressure dependence of the band offset show that both (1 1 1)A and (1 0 0) oriented structures have a pressure coefficient of 10.7 meV/kbar, but the band crossing at zero pressure is larger for the (1 1 1)A case. Compensated quantum Hall plateaux are observed at high magnetic fields and low temperatures, and large oscillatory features are observed in the Hall voltage under a range of conditions. In very high fields we have observed the zero-resistance Hall plateaux occurring due to total compensation of the electron and hole states.
C1 ACAD SCI TROITSK,INST HIGH PRESSURE PHYS,TROITSK,RUSSIA.
   UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
   CATHOLIC UNIV LEUVEN,DEPT PHYS,B-3000 LOUVAIN,BELGIUM.

TI INSULATOR-LIKE MINIBAND TRANSPORT IN HEAVILY DOPED SUPERLATTICES UNDER
   HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
AB We have studied the miniband transport of electrons in heavily doped superlattices under high magnetic fields to examine the possibility of realizing an insulator-like state where all the states in the lowest miniband are completely occupied. A quite large peak is indeed found in the longitudinal magnetoresistance at a magnetic field where the quantum limit is reached, reflecting the presence of a true minigap separating two minibands. The temperature dependence of the peaked feature is also studied to evaluate both the broadening factor and true shape of the density of states.

TI HIGH-FREQUENCY MEASUREMENTS OF THE MAGNETORESISTANCE ANOMALY OF KISH
   GRAPHITE UNDER PULSED HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID ELECTRONIC PHASE-TRANSITION; NON-OHMIC TRANSPORT; DENSITY-WAVE PHASE
AB The frequency dependence of the magnetoresistance of kish graphite was measured up to 10 MHz using phase-sensitive detection techniques under pulsed high magnetic fields. Large changes of both amplitude and phase of the magnetoresistance were found above the critical field of the phase transition. The anomaly was also observed in the transmission measurement in the millimeter-wave range (155 GHz).

TI MAGNETIC-FIELD-INDUCED ELECTRONIC PHASE-TRANSITION IN GRAPHITE - PULSE
   FIELD EXPERIMENT AT HE-3 TEMPERATURES
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID QUANTUM LIMIT; MAGNETORESISTANCE; TRANSPORT
AB The magnetic-field-induced electronic phase transition in graphite is investigated over a wide region of the magnetic field-temperature (H-T) plane (H less-than-or-equal-to 45 T and T greater-than-or-equal-to 0.6 K) by using a He-3 refrigerator and a pulse magnet. A number of new features has been found in the previously unexplored high-field range.

TI HIGH-FIELD MAGNETOOPTICAL STUDY OF LOCALIZED EXCITONS IN CDTE/CD1-XMNXTE
   MULTIPLE QUANTUM-WELLS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID SEMICONDUCTORS; CD1-XMNXTE; DYNAMICS; POLARON
AB The photoluminescence (PL) spectra of CdTe/Cd1-xMnxTe multiple quantum wells (MQW) were measured in pulsed magnetic fields up to 40 T. The samples were grown on GaAs(1 0 0) substrates at 320-degrees-C (lower-T(s) sample) and 360-degrees-C (higher-T(s) sample) by the molecular beam epitaxy (MBE) method. In the magnetic field dependence of the PL peak positions, both red and blue shifts were observed in the low- and high-magnetic-field regions, respectively. The former is interpreted as a large Zeeman effect caused by the penetration of the exciton wavefunction of the CdTe quantum well layer into the Cd1-xMnxTe barrier layer. The tatter is due to a diamagnetic shift of excitons in the CdTe quantum well layer. In the case of the higher-T(s) samples, no diamagnetic shift and anomalously large Zeeman shift were observed. These facts suggest that excitons in the quantum well layer of higher-T(s) samples are localized at the heterointerfaces of CdTe/Cd1-xMnxTe. The origin of the localization is discussed.

   HG(FE)SE
SO PHYSICA B

CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID MAGNETIC SEMICONDUCTORS
AB Applying pulsed magnetic fields up to 150 T, we have studied infrared and far-infrared properties of HgSe and its semimagnetic modification Hg(Fe)Se (N(Fe) = 2 X 10(19) cm-3). The observed spectra are discussed with respect to the relevance of Fe-impurity states, which - despite their crucial influence on charge transport characteristics - have not yet been clearly distinguished in optical experiments.

TI HIGH-FIELD MAGNETOTRANSPORT PHENOMENA IN ORGANIC LOW-DIMENSIONAL
   CONDUCTORS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33RD YAMADA CONF / 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON THE APPLICATION OF HIGH
   MAGNETIC FIELDS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS ( HMSP 92 )
CY AUG 03-07, 1992
CL CHIBA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN, GOVT CHIBA PREFECTURE, GOVT TOMIURA CITY
ID (TMTSF)2CLO4; MAGNETORESISTANCE; OSCILLATIONS; ANISOTROPY
AB We discuss some novel characteristic phenomena observed in the quasi-one-dimensional organic conductor (TMTSF)2ClO4, which has a highly anisotropic simple conduction band. We propose the 'angular-dependent magneto-resistance resonance' and the 'paramagnetic quantum oscillation' as possible mechanisms for the two novel magneto-oscillatory phenomena. We also explain the unusual phase diagram of the field-induced spin-density-wave state by an additional superlattice potential.

TI MAGNETOOPTICAL STUDY ON EXCITONIC SPECTRA IN (C6H13NH3)2PBI4
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID BAND-EDGE EXCITONS; QUANTUM WELLS; FIELDS; SEMICONDUCTOR; 40-T; PBI2;
   (C10H21NH3)2PBI4
AB Magnetoabsorption spectra of the lowest-energy excitons in a layered perovskite-type material (C6H13NH3)2PbI4 have been measured under pulsed high magnetic fields up to 42 T at 4.2 K in the Faraday configuration (E perpendicular-to c parallel-to B) and the Voigt configuration (E perpendicular-to c perpendicular-to B). Energy shifts and splittings in the spectra for the Voigt configuration have been observed in this material. For the Faraday configuration, the Zeeman splitting with small diamagnetic shifts has clearly been detected. The diamagnetic coefficients obtained are much smaller than that for PbI2, suggesting that the Wannier-exciton model is not a good approximation for the lowest-energy excitions in (C6H13NH3)2PbI4. Theoretical analysis based on the cationic Frenkel-exciton model yields semiquantitative agreement with the experimental results.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELD EFFECT ON EXCITON ENERGIES IN CDTE CD1-XMNXTE
   QUANTUM-WELLS GROWN BY MBE
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9th International Conference on Ternary and Multinary Compounds
   (ICTMC-9)
CY AUG 08-12, 1993
CL YOKOHAMA, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, CERAM SOC JAPAN, CHEM SOC JAPAN, ELECTROCHEM SOC JAPAN, INST ELECT ENGINEERS JAPAN, INST ELECTR INFORMAT & COMMUN ENGINEERS, JAPANESE ASSOC CRYSTAL GROWTH, JAPAN INST MET, MAGNET SOC JAPAN, PHYS SOC JAPAN, SPECTROSCOP SOC JAPAN
DE DILUTED MAGNETIC SEMICONDUCTOR; MULTIPLE QUANTUM WELL; ABSORPTION
   SPECTRA; HIGH MAGNETIC FIELD; EXCITONIC TRANSITION
ID CDTE (CD,MN)TE; BINDING-ENERGY; BAND-OFFSETS; HOLE-SUBBAND;
   SUPERLATTICES; GAAS
AB The magneto-optical studies were performed through the transmission measurement on a series of CdTe/Cd1-xMnxTe multiple quantum wells with Mn contents of about 14% under pulsed magnetic fields up to 45 T. Observed absorption peaks of the heavy-hole and light-hole excitons show large Zeeman splitting due to the exchange interaction with Mn2+ Spins in the barrier layer. Further, the observation of a series of Landau level transitions between the conduction and heavy-hole bands gives an estimate of the excitonic binding energy at 11-22 meV depending on the well width. The calculation based on the effective-mass approximation reveals that the hole states under magnetic fields exhibit complicated features due to the valence-band mixture and the strong sp-d exchange interaction. Calculated results of the interband transition energies and intensities were compared with the observations and help for their understanding.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
RP KURODA, S (reprint author), UNIV TSUKUBA,INST MAT SCI,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI FABRICATION AND HIGH-FIELD MAGNETOABSORPTION STUDY OF CDTE CD1-XMNXTE
   MULTIPLE-QUANTUM WELLS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9th International Conference on Ternary and Multinary Compounds
   (ICTMC-9)
CY AUG 08-12, 1993
CL YOKOHAMA, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, CERAM SOC JAPAN, CHEM SOC JAPAN, ELECTROCHEM SOC JAPAN, INST ELECT ENGINEERS JAPAN, INST ELECTR INFORMAT & COMMUN ENGINEERS, JAPANESE ASSOC CRYSTAL GROWTH, JAPAN INST MET, MAGNET SOC JAPAN, PHYS SOC JAPAN, SPECTROSCOP SOC JAPAN
DE CDTE/CD1-XMNXTE MULTIPLE QUANTUM WELLS; HIGH-FIELD MAGNETOABSORPTION
   SPECTRA; HETEROINTERFACE; CLUSTER BEAM DEPOSITION
ID OPTICAL PROPERTIES; CD1-XMNXTE; EXCITONS; SEMICONDUCTORS; DYNAMICS
AB The high-field magneto-absorption spectra of CdTe/Cd1-xMnxTe multiple quantum wells (x = 0.25 and 0.4) were measured in pulsed magnetic fields up to 40 T. The samples were grown by cluster beam deposition method on GaAs substrates and removed from the substrates before the absorption measurement. The investigation showed that the interaction between the excitons in the well layers and the unpaired Mn-spins at the heterointerfaces play the decisive role of the magneto-optical effect in the multiple quantum wells.
C1 ELECTROTECH LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,ISSP,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI PROMOTING EFFECTS OF NOBLE-METALS ON THE DETECTION OF AMMONIA BY
   SEMICONDUCTOR GAS SENSOR
SO STUDIES IN SURFACE SCIENCE AND CATALYSIS
LA English
DT Article
AB The sensing properties of Pt (0.4 wt%)-WO3 element to dilute NH3 in air were greatly improved by treating the element with dilute H2S in air. The treated element was very sensitive to NH3 at 250-degrees-C with the sensitivity as high as 1100 to 50 ppm NH3, and could detect excellently NH3 in the concentration range of 0.5 is similar to 50 ppm. It was suggested that the partial poisoning of Pt by sulfur would be the origin of the improvement of sensing properties.
RP MAEKAWA, T (reprint author), KYUSHU UNIV,GRAD SCH ENGN SCI,DEPT MAT SCI & TECHNOL,KASUGA,FUKUOKA 816,JAPAN.

TI ROLE OF AMORPHOUS PHASE AND ITS MODIFICATION IN V-P-O CATALYSTS FOR
   MALEIC-ANHYDRIDE SYNTHESIS FROM BUTANE
SO STUDIES IN SURFACE SCIENCE AND CATALYSIS
LA English
DT Article
ID ACTIVE PHASE; MIXED-OXIDE; OXIDATION; PHOSPHORUS
AB V-P-O catalysts were investigated for the maleic anhydride (MA) synthesis from butane. The V-P-O catalysts with P/V ratios larger than unity were a mixture of crystalline (VO)2P2O7 and an amorphous phase having P/V=2. The amorphous phase, when separated, showed MA formation activity per unit surface area comparable to that of the unseparated catalyst. The addition of some metal cations to the catalysts markedly increased the rate of butane oxidation and/or MA selectivity. Particularly, Bi-added catalyst prepared from the organic solution showed the highest MA yield of 62 mol% at 395-degrees-C.
RP YAMAZOE, N (reprint author), KYUSHU UNIV, GRAD SCH ENGN SCI, DEPT MAT SCI & TECHNOL, KASUGA, FUKUOKA 816, JAPAN.

TI SELECTIVE OXIDATION AND AMMOXIDATION OF PROPANE TO FORM ACROLEIN AND
   ACRYLONITRILE
SO STUDIES IN SURFACE SCIENCE AND CATALYSIS
LA English
DT Article
ID METAL-OXIDE CATALYSTS; HETEROGENEOUS STEPS
AB Partial oxidation of propane to acrolein and ammoxidation to acrylonitrile with molecular oxygen were carried out over complex metal oxide catalysts made up of bismuth oxide, molybdenum oxide or vanadium oxide and further modified with another metal oxide. The selective formations of acrolein and acrylonitrile required high reaction temperature around 500-degrees-C and reactant feeds of high partial pressures of propane. Under the conditions, the reactions involve homogeneous reactions in the gas phase where thermally activated propane converts into propene. In the case of low propane partial pressure condition where the contribution of the homogeneous reaction is negligible, vanadium oxide-based catalysts were mostly active for the formation of acrylonitrile in the ammoxidation. Bismuth molybate catalyst showed fairly high selectivity to acrylonitrile, however the activity being quite low.
C1 TOKYO INST TECHNOL, DEPT ENVIRONM CHEM & ENGN, MIDORI KU, YOKOHAMA, KANAGAWA 227, JAPAN.
RP MOROOKA, Y (reprint author), TOKYO INST TECHNOL, RESOURCES UTILIZAT RES LAB, 4259 NAGATSUTA CHO, MIDORI KU, YOKOHAMA, KANAGAWA 227, JAPAN.

AU MIURA, N
   SHINYASHIKI, N
   MASHIMO, S
AF MIURA, N
   SHINYASHIKI, N
   MASHIMO, S
TI DIELECTRIC-RELAXATION OF THE KOHLRAUSCH-TYPE IN AQUEOUS POLYMER-SOLUTION
SO JOURNAL OF CHEMICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID TIME DOMAIN SPECTROSCOPY; SEGMENTAL CHAIN DYNAMICS; SCALE SHIFTS;
   BEHAVIOR; WATER; HZ
AB Micro-Brownian motion of polymer chain in aqueous solution was clearly observed at first for poly(vinyl pyrrolidone) as a dielectric relaxation by a time domain reflectometry method which covers an extremely wide frequency region from 100 kHz-10 GHz. The dielectric response function observed is of the Kohlrausch-type as expected for the chain motion, phi(t)=exp[-(t/tau(l))beta l]. Concentration dependence of the relaxation time tau(l) at 25-degrees-C is given by log tau(l)=-9.77-1.35/(c(d)-2.07), where c(d) is the polymer concentration (g/cc), and that of the coupling parameter beta(l) is given by beta(l)=-0.182c(d)+0.662. These dependences are characteristic features of the relaxation caused by the chain motion.
RP MIURA, N (reprint author), TOKAI UNIV,DEPT PHYS,HIRATSUKA,KANAGAWA 25912,JAPAN.

TI DEVELOPMENT OF THE EVALUATION METHOD FOR CRACK-PROPAGATION DUE TO
   THERMAL STRIPING
SO NUCLEAR ENGINEERING AND DESIGN
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH JAPANESE / GERMAN JOINT SEMINAR
CY OCT 11-12, 1990
CL MUNICH, GERMANY
AB The evaluation code ''THERST'' was developed to estimate the fatigue crack propagation behavior under thermal stresses due to high-frequency temperature fluctuations, called ''thermal striping''. This paper presents fundamental formulations of the evaluation method and verifications of the evaluation method by FEM analyses. Experimental data were obtained in high cycle thermal fatigue tests and the effect of a multiple crack which is characteristic for a crack under thermal stress is discussed in addition to the results of the FEM analyses. A modification of the evaluation method was performed to take multiple crack effects into account.
C1 CENT RES INST ELECT POWER IND,KOMAE,TOKYO,JAPAN.
RP SHIMAKAWA, T (reprint author), KAWASAKI HEAVY IND CO LTD,2-4-25 MINAMISUNA,KOTO KU,TOKYO,JAPAN.

TI PHOTOLUMINESCENCE SPECTRA AND ANISOTROPIC ENERGY SHIFT OF GAAS QUANTUM
   WIRES IN HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID CHEMICAL VAPOR-DEPOSITION; NANOMETER SCALE WIRE; SELECTIVE EPITAXY; DOT
   STRUCTURES; ELECTRON-GAS; WELL; HETEROSTRUCTURES; SUPERLATTICES;
   FABRICATION; EXCITON
AB Magnetophotoluminescence spectra of GaAs quantum wires with lateral and vertical dimensions of 20 and 10 nm, respectively, were measured up to 40 T with three orthogonal magnetic field configurations. The observed photoluminescence peak shift with increase of applied magnetic field was strongly dependent on the direction of magnetic field, which directly demonstrates the existence of two-dimensional confinement in the quantum wires. It was found that the excitons were anisotropically shrunk in the quantum wires, and that the observed magnetic energy shift was consistent with the size of the quantum wire structure.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
RP NAGAMUNE, Y (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,ADV SCI & TECHNOL RES CTR,4-6-1 KOMABA,MEGURO KU,TOKYO 153,JAPAN.

TI OPTICAL-PROPERTIES AND DYNAMIC BEHAVIOR OF LOCALIZED AND BOUND EXCITONS
   IN CD1-XMNXTE(X=4-PERCENT) GROWN BY MOLECULAR-BEAM EPITAXY
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID DILUTED MAGNETIC SEMICONDUCTORS; PHOTOLUMINESCENCE SPECTRA; POLARON
   FORMATION; CD1-XMNXTE; FIELD; (CD,MN)TE; ALLOYS; CDTE
AB An epitaxial Cd1-xMnxTe(x=4%) layer has been grown on a CdTe buffer layer on a GaAs substrate by the molecular-beam-epitaxy method. Comparing the photoluminescence (PL) spectra of Cd1-xMnxTe with those of CdTe, two peaks in the Cd1-xMnxTe PL domain were assigned to localized and bound exciton emissions. The results obtained by PL measurements in magnetic fields up to 40 T support this assignment. The observed temporal energy shifts of the localized and bound exciton emissions can be attributed to localized and bound magnetic polaron formations, respectively. Comparing the temporal behavior of bound excitons in magnetic fields with that of localized excitons, a possible process of the bound magnetic polaron formation is discussed.
C1 UNIV TSUKUBA,INST MAT SCI,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI THE STRUCTURE OF WATER DETERMINED BY MICROWAVE DIELECTRIC STUDY ON WATER
   MIXTURES WITH GLUCOSE, POLYSACCHARIDES, AND L-ASCORBIC-ACID
SO JOURNAL OF CHEMICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID DEPOLARIZED RAYLEIGH-SCATTERING; LIQUID WATER; COMPLEX PERMITTIVITY;
   NEUTRON-SCATTERING; FREQUENCY; TIME; TEMPERATURE
AB Dielectric relaxation measurements over an extremely wide frequency region from 1 MHz to 20 GHz were performed on water mixtures with glucose, polysaccharides, and L-xylo ascorbic acid by the use of time domain reflectometry. For mixtures of polysaccharides bigger than maltotriose, two relaxation peaks were definitely observed. The high frequency relaxation is the water relaxation and the low frequency one is due to orientation of polysaccharide molecules. In the case of glucose, only one relaxation peak could be observed. It is shown that a hexagonal cluster in the lattice of ice can be replaced easily by the glucose molecule, where the lattice is distorted slightly, but stabilized by several hydrogen bonds between the glucose molecule and the lattice. Although the cluster can be replaced by the L-ascorbic acid molecule too, the lattice cannot be kept stable. Its water mixture shows two relaxation peaks clearly. It is suggested that water has a structure of the distorted lattice of ire. Fluctuation of the lattice breaks the hydrogen bonds and the lattice is decomposed. Orientation of the water molecules released gives rise to the relaxation concerned.
RP MASHIMO, S (reprint author), TOKAI UNIV,DEPT PHYS,HIRATSUKA,KANAGAWA 25912,JAPAN.

TI HIGH-PERFORMANCE SOLID-ELECTROLYTE CARBON-DIOXIDE SENSOR WITH A BINARY
   CARBONATE ELECTRODE
SO SENSORS AND ACTUATORS B-CHEMICAL
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SOLID-STATE SENSORS AND ACTUATORS (
   TRANSDUCERS 91 )
CY JUN 24-28, 1991
CL SAN FRANCISCO, CA
ID GAS SENSOR; SENSING CHARACTERISTICS; OXIDES; PROBE
AB A compact solid-state CO2 sensor based upon an Na+-conducting solid electrolyte (NASICON) can be improved drastically in response time and water vapour resistance by the use of a binary carbonate electrode of BaCO3 - Na2CO3. For a wide range of CO2 concentration from 4 to 400 000 ppm, the electromotive force (e.m.f.) examined at 550-degrees-C follows a Nernst equation correspondence to a two-electron reaction of CO2, with a 90% response time as short as 8 s or less. Water vapour hardly affects the sensor characteristics, in contrast to the case of a pure Na2CO3 electrode. The structure and CO2-sensing mechanism of the binary carbonate electrode are also discussed.
RP MIURA, N (reprint author), KYUSHU UNIV,GRAD SCH ENGN SCI,DEPT MAT SCI & TECHNOL,KASUGA,FUKUOKA 816,JAPAN.

TI CUO-SNO2 ELEMENT FOR HIGHLY SENSITIVE AND SELECTIVE DETECTION OF H2S
SO SENSORS AND ACTUATORS B-CHEMICAL
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SOLID-STATE SENSORS AND ACTUATORS (
   TRANSDUCERS 91 )
CY JUN 24-28, 1991
CL SAN FRANCISCO, CA
ID GAS SENSORS; ADDITIVES; SNO2
AB Among the various metal oxide additives tested, CuO is outstanding in promoting the sensing properties of an SnO2 element for H2S in air. The SnO2 element loaded with 5 wt.% CuO is extremely sensitive to H2S at 200-degrees-C and below, while it is almost insensitive to many other gases, except for CH3SH. The response to H2S is rather slow but the recovery is very rapid. The evidence collected from X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) measurements suggests that the added CuO particles interact electronically with the surface of SnO2 (p-n junctions) to make the element highly resistive, while the interaction is disconnected when CuO is sulfurized to CuS in the H2S-containing atmosphere, leading to a drastic decrease in electrical resistance. The H2S-sensing properties, particularly the rate of response, of CuO-SnO2 elements are influenced by the CuO loadings as well as the CuO-loading methods.
RP TAMAKI, J (reprint author), KYUSHU UNIV,GRAD SCH ENGN SCI,DEPT MAT SCI & TECHNOL,KASUGA,FUKUOKA 816,JAPAN.

TI POTENTIOMETRIC AND AMPEROMETRIC GLUCOSE SENSOR USING PROTON-CONDUCTIVE
   THICK-FILM
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
ID ELECTRODES; OXIDASE; FABRICATION; PLATINUM
AB New solid-state enzyme sensors capable of potentiometric or amperometric detection of glucose were explored based on the proton-conductive thick-film of antimonic acid spin coated on a porous alumina substrate. Two types of planar sensor element were fabricated by depositing the sensing electrode (Pt), counter electrode (Au) and/or reference electrode (Ag) on top of the proton-conductive film by RF sputtering (Figs. 1 and 2). Glucose oxidase (GOD) was applied on the Pt electrode together with a carbon paste which not only immobilized GOD but also protected the proton-conductive film from deterioration in the phosphate buffer solution (Fig.4), while the remaining surface was covered with a water-proof coating layer. The two-electrode type element attached with a pair of sensing and counter electrodes worked as a potentiometric sensor which varied emf logarithmically with a change in the concentration of dissolved O2, H2O2, and glucose (5 x 10(-4) approximately 4 x 10(-2) M) in the phosphate buff er solution (Figs.5 and 6). The Nernst's slope (-54 mV/decade) for glucose coincided perfectly with that for H2O2, indicating that the response to glucose is generated through its enzymatic reaction product, H2O2. The sensitivity to glucose was fairly stable for 10 days (Fig. 7). The same element could be used as an amperometric sensor when the sensing Pt electrode was polarized vs. an external Saturated Calomel Electrode (SCE) (Fig. 8), and the electrolytic current at the fixed polarization of 0.7 V (vs. SCE) was well correlated with the glucose concentration (Fig. 9). This finding facilitated the design of three-electrode type element by incorporating an internal reference Ag electrode which was inactive to H2O2 (Fig. 10). The electrolytic current of this element increased as the Pt electrode was polarized vs. the Ag electrode (Figs. 11 snf 12), and the amperometric response at the polarization of 0. 7 V was linear to the concentrations of H2O2 and glucose (0 approximately 7 x 10(-3) M) (Fig. 13), with the rather rapid response rates (Fig. 14).   It was further shown that the short-circuit current of the two-electrode type element could also be utilized for the amperometric detection of dissolved O2, H2O2, and glucose (0 approximately 4 x 10(-3) M) in the buff er solution (Figs. 15,16, and 17).
RP MATAYOSHI, N (reprint author), KYUSHU UNIV,GRAD SCH ENGN SCI,DEPT MAT SCI & TECHNOL,KASUGA,FUKUOKA 816,JAPAN.

AU DESHIMARU, Y

AF DESHIMARU, Y

TI RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN OXYGEN-CONTENT, MODULATION PERIOD AND
   SUPERCONDUCTING PROPERTY OF BIBASED SUPERCONDUCTING OXIDES
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
ID CU-O SYSTEM; RESOLUTION ELECTRON-MICROSCOPY; HIGH-TC BI(PB)-SR-CA-CU-O;
   SR; DIFFRACTION; NONSTOICHIOMETRY; TEMPERATURE; TRANSITION; DESORPTION;
   PHASE
AB The influences of oxygen contents on the structural parameters and superconducting properties of Pb-doped Bi-Sr-Ca-Cu-O samples (2223 and 2212 phases) were examined. Temperature-programmed-desorption (TPD) measurements revealed that sorption and desorption of small amounts of oxygen (2 approximately 3 x 10(-5) mol/g) took place reversibly for both samples below 600-degrees-C (Figs.3,8). The lattice parameter along c axis and the structural modulation period along b axis in each sample were found to increase as oxygen content decrease and vice versa (Figs. 5,7).  These reversible changes in structural parameters could be explained to result from the desorption and sorption of excess oxygen in Bi-O layer. The dependence of T(c) on the oxygen content for the 2223 sample was quite different from that for the 2212 sample, i.e., with decreasing the oxygen content T(c) of the former decreased by 15 K from 111 K to 96 K, while the latter increased (Figs.4,9).  These results suggest that for both samples T(c) is related with the hole concentration in CuO2 plane which is controlled by oxygen content.
C1 KYOTO UNIV,INST CHEM RES,UJI,KYOTO 611,JAPAN.
RP DESHIMARU, Y (reprint author), KYUSHU UNIV,GRAD SCH ENGN SCI,DEPT MAT SCI & TECHNOL,KASUGA,FUKUOKA 816,JAPAN.

TI MOLECULAR-CLONING AND BACTERIAL EXPRESSION OF CDNA-ENCODING A PLANT
   CYSTEINE SYNTHASE
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE NATIONAL ACADEMY OF SCIENCES OF THE UNITED STATES OF
   AMERICA
LA English
DT Article
DE SPINACIA-OLERACEA L; GENETIC COMPLEMENTATION;
   O-ACETYLSERINE(THIOL)-LYASE; SULFUR ASSIMILATION; PYRIDOXAL PHOSPHATE
ID DIRECT GENETIC SELECTION; ESCHERICHIA-COLI; NUCLEOTIDE-SEQUENCE;
   DIHYDRODIPICOLINATE SYNTHASE; ENZYMATIC-SYNTHESIS; PROTEIN; ACID
AB Cysteine synthase (CSase) [O-acetyl-L-serine acetate-lyase (adding hydrogen sulfide), EC 4.2.99.8] catalyzes the formation of L-cysteine, the key step in sulfur assimilation in plants, from O-acetyl-L-serine and hydrogen sulfide. We report here the isolation and characterization of cDNA clones encoding cysteine synthase from spinach (Spinacia oleracea L.). Internal peptide sequences were obtained from V8 protease-digested fragments of purified CSase. A lambda-gt10 cDNA library was constructed from poly(A)+ RNA of young green leaves of spinach. Screening with two synthetic mixed nucleotides encoding the partial peptide sequences revealed 19 positively hybridized clones among 2 x 10(5) clones. Nucleotide sequence analysis of two independent cDNA clones revealed a continuous open reading frame encoding a polypeptide of 325 amino acids with a calculated molecular mass of 34,185 Da. Sequence comparison of the deduced amino acids revealed 53% identity with CSases of Escherichia coli and Salmonella typhimurium. Sequence homology was also observed with other metabolic enzymes for amino acids in bacteria and yeast and with rat hemoprotein H-450. A bacterial expression vector was constructed and could genetically complement an E. coli auxotroph that lacks CSases. The accumulation of functionally active spinach CSase in E. coli was also demonstrated by immunoblotting and assaying enzymatic activity. Southern hybridization analysis showed the presence of two to three copies of the cDNA sequence in the genome of spinach. RNA blot hybridization suggested constitutive expression in leaves and roots of spinach.
C1 NATL INST AGROBIOL RESOURCES,DEPT MOLEC BIOL,TSUKUBA 305,JAPAN.

TI FIELD-INDUCED SPIN-DENSITY-WAVE INSTABILITY OF THE ANISOTROPIC
   2-DIMENSIONAL ELECTRON-SYSTEM UNDER LATERAL SUPERLATTICE POTENTIAL
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID BECHGAARD SALTS; MAGNETIC OSCILLATIONS; ORGANIC CONDUCTOR; (TMTSF)2CLO4;
   TRANSITIONS
AB We study the effect of a lateral superlattice potential on the field-induced spin-density-wave (FISDW) instability of the highly anisotropic two-dimensional electron system under magnetic fields. The superlattice with period double the interchain distance causes an oscillatory double splitting of the magnetic energy spectrum. It suppresses the transition into the FISDW subphases with even index numbers. We apply this model to thc organic superconductor (TMTSF)2ClO4 with the anion-ordering superlattice, and give a possible explanation for its anomalous FISDW behavior.

TI ELECTROCHROMISM OF VANADIUM-TITANIUM OXIDE THIN-FILMS PREPARED BY
   SPIN-COATING METHOD
SO APPLIED PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB Electrochromic properties of V2O5-TiO2 thin films prepared by a spin-coating method were strongly dependent on the film compositions and heat-treatment temperatures. It was found that the nearly amorphous film of V2O5-TiO2 (3:7 in molar ratio) heat-treated at 400-degrees-C showed coloration to reddish brown when polarized at -0.8 V vs SCE. This new coloration was concluded to be ascribable to amorphous vanadium oxide.

TI HIGH-FIELD PHASE IN THE MAGNETIC-FIELD-INDUCED ELECTRONIC
   PHASE-TRANSITION OF GRAPHITE
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID CHARGE-DENSITY-WAVE; QUANTUM LIMIT; MAGNETORESISTANCE
AB The magnetoresistance of single-crystal graphite has been measured at low temperatures in pulsed high magnetic fields up to 52 T applied parallel to the c axis.  Many features were found in the high-field phase after the field-induced electronic phase transition.  After the sharp rise at the phase transition, the resistance shows a dramatic decrease with increasing field, indicating the reentrant character of the phase boundary.  The phase transition was no longer observed at the elevated temperature of 10.8 K in a field up to 48 T.  Fine structures consisting of local maxima and an inflection point were observed in the high-field phase.  Although the temperature dependence of the critical field is qualitatively in accord with Yoshioka and Fukuyama's charge-density-wave model, a more detailed theory is required to explain most of the present observation.
RP OCHIMIZU, H (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI INVESTIGATING THE CUBIC ANISOTROPY OF THE CONFINED HOLE SUBBANDS OF AN
   ALAS/GAAS/ALAS QUANTUM-WELL USING RESONANT MAGNETOTUNNELING SPECTROSCOPY
SO APPLIED PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID HETEROJUNCTIONS; FIELD
AB The energy-wave-vector dispersion curves and cubic anisotropy of the confined hole subbands of a (001) AlAs/GaAs/AlAs valence-band quantum well are studied in resonant magnetotunneling experiments using pulsed magnetic fields up to 41 T. The experimental results are compared with calculations using a six-band model which includes the effect of the finite electric field in the quantum well. The comparison convincingly demonstrates that the technique is sufficiently accurate to measure fine details of the band structure of the valence-band quantum well.

TI 55-T LONG PULSE MAGNET REINFORCED BY ICE AND WOVEN-GLASS CLOTHS
SO MEASUREMENT SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRONIC PHASE-TRANSITION; FIELD; CONDUCTOR; GRAPHITE
AB A simple method of constructing a multilayer wire-wound pulse magnet was developed by using ice with woven-glass cloth as a reinforcement spacer, Employing strong copper-wire embedded with Nb-Ti filaments, magnetic fields up to 58 T were generated within an 18 mm bore-diameter with a pulse duration of about 8 ms. Even with soft copper-wire, magnetic fields of over 45 T were produced. The advantages of this method are: (1) easy construction of the magnet, without any troublesome processes such as epoxy impregnation or high-pressure solidification, (2) fast cooling time after a large current discharge, (3) recovery from fatigued insulation after multiple use by a process of warming up the magnet once to room temperature and cooling it again to liquid nitrogen temperature, forming a new ice binder for the woven-glass fibres.

TI LAF3-BASED OXYGEN SENSOR USING PB PHTHALOCYANINE ELECTRODE FOR QUICK
   RESPONSE AT ROOM-TEMPERATURE
SO SENSORS AND ACTUATORS B-CHEMICAL
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRICAL-CONDUCTIVITY CHANGES; SENSING ELECTRODE
AB A solid-electrolyte oxygen sensor operative at room temperature is constructed by using an LaF3 single crystal (fluoride ion conductor) and Pb phthalocyanine as a sensing-electrode material. The e.m.f. change of the sensor on oxygen partial pressure variation is found to be stable and characterized by two-electron reduction of the oxygen molecule. Moreover, the 90% response time of the sensor is as short as about 30 s at 30-degrees-C.

TI DEVELOPMENT OF SNO2-BASED ETHANOL GAS SENSOR
SO SENSORS AND ACTUATORS B-CHEMICAL
LA English
DT Article
ID SENSING PROPERTIES; ADDITIVES
AB The sensitivity and selectivity of SnO2-based elements to ethanol vapour (1000 ppm) in air at 300-degrees-C are found to be markedly promoted by the addition of several basic oxides, among which La2O3 is the most influential. The promoting effect seems to appear through a change of the reaction selectivity between the two oxidation routes for C2H5OH. Although these elements are rather slow in response rate. this can be improved significantly by loading the elements further with noble metal (Pd or Pt). Thc doubly promoted elements, Pd(0.5 wt.%)-La2O3(5 wt.%)-SnO2 and Pt(O.5wt.%)-La2O3-SnO2. show excellent sensing properties to ethanol vapour in the range 100-1000 ppm at 300-degrees-C.
C1 EHIME UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL CHEM,MATSUYAMA,EHIME 790,JAPAN.
